name: Realities
description: Explore what was out of reach before - travel to mesmerizing real world places and discover their stories!
minimum_requirements: Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system OS: Windows 8 or newer Processor: Intel i5-4590 or similar Memory: 8 GB RAM Graphics: Geforce GTX 970 or similar DirectX: Version 11 Storage: 12 GB available space Additional Notes: Supports the Oculus remote.
recommended_requirements: Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system OS: Windows 8 or newer Processor: Intel i7-4770 or similar Memory: 8 GB RAM Graphics: Geforce GTX 980 Ti or similar DirectX: Version 11 Storage: 12 GB available space Additional Notes: Supports the Oculus remote.

reviews.review_text: Fantastic. While the areas need more examples of the guided tour audio and photos to interact with, the application is very immersive and their models are amazingly detailed. I'm hoping the platform is open so more groups like national parks or museums can map, model, and upload their own local scenes for folks to visit.

If there's a few more areas added and all of them have commentary, I'd be willing to pay. I don't understand why people would compare this to The Lab, just because it's free. It's a completely different beast, not the same category at all.  Anyway, I enjoyed it. I've never heard of these places before and when I found my first leaflet it was really enjoyable for me. Great work guys!  Oh and I guess there was some tutorial guy the first time I loaded it, but I jumped into a place too quick and just heard the greeting... made me scared that this would be 'multiplayer' and I'd blink around with other people discussing things. The guy on top of that castle didn't help! :D

A cool tech demo showing of something like 'VR tourism”. The 3D world and textures doesn't exactly seem to be in very high definition, despite the 12GB footprint, but it has a nice voiceover explaining what you look at using both voice, 2D still-images, text reacting depending on your orientation etc.  Not that much to see yet but cool nonetheless.
Crashed and left the Vive in a black state, had to reboot. Only 5 places ...really poor example. Worse than the google cardboard one.

An interesting idea with poor implementation and limited scope. - Low quality textures. - Only four locations, as of early June, all in Europe. - Flyers used to give extra information are small static 2D images + sound.  See the 'postcards' section in Valve's 'the lab' for a better free environment simulator. Or use wikipedia and google maps to see more varied environments with more comfortable access to more information.

Great concept, Only thing I dislike is the quality of the areas is like super bad, Weird sections, blurred smudged areas, Doesn't do the real areas justice. Would have prefured the areas be 3D models rather than what looks to be a google maps street view kinda thing. Image quality just isn't good enough.
This is awesome and has so much potential. I would really like to be able to visit and explore far away places.

It seems unfinished. The resolution needs work and there are only 3 locations. When they can improve the graphics and add more content, I'd certainly pay for something like this. But it's free and experimental right now, and it has great potential.
This is awesome! I love sitting on top of the German castle. I really hope you guys add more.

When I downloaded this game there were four places to travel to, I hope many more are to come. First I went to France and thought, 'Okay, this could be informitive if more depth were added.' Then I went to Germany. I entered Burgruine Hohenrechberg castle, walked up to the first panphlet, listened to a description of the surrounding area, and was overwhelmed by the implications this would have on VR Education. I had to sit down and relax due to my mind racing. This is just the beginning.

Great experience. Looking forward to more scenes. For me personnaly, they are not exotic enough. I can and have seen these types of places many times in my lifetime. Would love to see some scenes from other continents.

Absolutly great and awesome experience. Not so much content at the moment, so don´t expect long trips through different locations, then you will be dissapointed maybe. At the moment there are 3 locations and in 2 you only can see one room. But it´s a really nice experience and I can´t wait for more places. Definitly something I will spend a lot of time with in the future. And that all for free, thanks a lot to the devs, keep on the good work.
Awesome, can't wait for more locations to visit.
